service_content.title: Poverty Reduction & MSME Development
service_content.description: Strategies and programs to reduce poverty and empower micro, small, and medium enterprises.

service_content.title: Agriculture and Land Use Services
service_content.description: Sustainable agricultural development and land use planning for food security and rural growth.

service_content.title: Peace Building & Conflict Resolution
service_content.description: Facilitating dialogue, stability, and social cohesion in fragile and conflict-affected settings.

service_content.title: Public Health & Nutrition
service_content.description: Improving health outcomes and nutrition through evidence-based interventions.

service_content.title: Education & Learning
service_content.description: Innovative education solutions and learning systems for sustainable development.

service_content.title: Program/Project Inception, Development & Assessment
service_content.description: Comprehensive support for program and project design, inception, and evaluation.

service_content.title: Monitoring, Evaluation & Learning
service_content.description: Robust MEL systems to track progress, learn, and improve outcomes.

service_content.title: Technology & Digital Transformation
service_content.description: Leveraging technology to drive innovation and digital transformation. PACT partners with Itqan, MobiPay AgroSys, Techurate, Sybyl, and PEC to deliver integrated mobile, web, and omni-channel solutions for microfinance, e-commerce, and more.
details: Integration with banks, MFIs, payment gateways, and value chains
Custom solutions for agriculture, skilled workers, education, retail, and more

client_content.name: UN Women
client_content.description: United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women.

client_content.name: World Food Programme (WFP)
client_content.description: The United Nations food-assistance agency and the world's largest humanitarian organization addressing hunger and promoting food security.

client_content.name: UNICEF
client_content.description: The United Nations agency responsible for providing humanitarian and developmental aid to children worldwide in over 190 countries and territories.

client_content.name: IFAD
client_content.description: International organization and agency of the UN whose objective is to improve agricultural development and livelihoods in developing countries.

client_content.name: IOM
client_content.description: The principal UN agency dedicated to the promotion of humane and orderly migration by providing services and advice to governments and migrants.

client_content.name: World Bank Group
client_content.description: International organization dedicated to providing financing, advice, and research to developing nations to aid their economic advancement.

client_content.name: British Council
client_content.description: The United Kingdom's international organization for cultural relations and educational opportunities.

client_content.name: Agricultural Bank of Sudan (ABS)
client_content.description: Agricultural Bank of Sudan

client_content.name: JICA
client_content.description: The implementing agency of Japanese official development aid for supporting the socioeconomic Development of developing regions.

client_content.name: FECCLAHA
client_content.description: A regional ecumenical organization for providing members with avenue for sharing perspectives on matters peace and conflict transformation stirred by the endless conflicts rampant in the region

client_content.name: Sudanese Microfinance Development Company (SMDC)
client_content.description: Sudanese Microfinance Development Company

client_content.name: Sudanese Peace Development Project (SPDP)
client_content.description: Sudanese Peace Development Project

client_content.description: Central Bank of Sudan

client_content.name: The Government of Sudan
client_content.description: The Government of Sudan

client_content.name: Darfur Regional Authority
client_content.description: Darfur Regional Authority.

client_content.name: Geneva Global
client_content.description: A Mission-Driven Company that Helps Foundations, Organizations, and Individuals Achieve Positive Social Change Through Effective Philanthropy and Consulting.

client_content.name: ITQAN
client_content.description: A financial technology solutions company with origins in Sudan, having spun out of PACT Consultancy in 2009.

client_content.name: Techurate
client_content.description: Global technology company that offers software, applications, quality assurance, testing, and channel banking solutions for banks and financial institutions.

client_content.name: FASID
client_content.description: Japanese organization that works to promote a peaceful and prosperous international society through human resource development and dissemination of information and experience.

client_content.name: Frankfurt School of Finance & Management
client_content.description: One of Europe’s leading business schools delivering German excellence in management and finance education.

client_content.name: AFCI (Agriculture & Finance Consultants)
client_content.description: A private German consulting firm focusing on agricultural, agribusiness and financial development projects in developing and transition countries.

client_content.name: KRC (Koei Research & Consulting Inc.)
client_content.description: A leading research and consulting company that provides high-quality, creative consulting services designed to meet the socio-economic challenges faced by developing countries and the world at large.

client_content.name: MUFG
client_content.description: The think tank arm of Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group that provides corporate management consulting, strategic support for global businesses, policy research and consulting.

client_content.name: Linpico
client_content.description: Established in 1991, Linpico is a multidisciplinary consultancy working worldwide in the field of International Development.

client_content.name: Sybyl
client_content.description: Global technology company with 30 years of experience, offering unique capabilities and solutions in the domain of Enterprise IT systems.

client_content.name: Botho Emerging Markets Group
client_content.description: Botho Emerging Markets Group is a leading advisor and consultant to investors, companies, governments and nonprofits navigating the world’s fastest-growing markets.

client_content.name: Khotawat
client_content.description: Khotawat is an IT and Management Consulting firm registered with the Organizing Council for Consultancy Firms (OCCF) – Sudan to provide consultancy services to private and public organizations.

client_content.name: EY (Ernest & Young)
client_content.description: Ernest & Young is a global leader in assurance, consulting, strategy and transactions, and tax services.

client_content.name: UNDP
client_content.description: The United Nations lead agency on international development, working in 170 countries and territories to eradicate poverty and reduce inequality.

client_content.name: Italian Agency for Development Cooperation (AICS)
client_content.description: The Italian Agency for Development Cooperation (AICS) is the public agency responsible for promoting international development, public aid and humanitarian emergencies.

client_content.name: Qatar Fund for Development
client_content.description: A public development institution committed, on behalf of the State of Qatar, to implement external aid projects to achieve inclusive and sustainable development.

client_content.name: Islamic Development Bank (IsDB)
client_content.description: A multilateral development bank, working to improve the lives of those it serves by promoting social and economic development in Member countries and Muslim communities worldwide.

client_content.name: Arigatou International
client_content.description: An international NGO in special consultative status with the United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC) and in consultative status with UNICEF

client_content.name: UMRA
client_content.description: An autonomous government agency in Uganda with the mandate to license, regulate and supervise all Tier 4 financial institutions including SACCOs.

client_content.name: Access to Finance Rwanda (AFR)
client_content.description: Access to Finance Rwanda is part of the broader Financial Sector Deepening (FSD) in Africa that seeks to create a transformative impact on the ending of poverty by supporting efforts to improve financial inclusion and financial sector development.

client_content.name: GOPA Consulting Group
client_content.description: A leading consulting group dedicated to performing and effectively contributing to international cooperation and global development, with more than 1000 projects worldwide in over 130 countries.

client_content.name: Craft Silicon
client_content.description: A Kenyan software house that provides software solutions for core Banking, Micro Finance, switching and electronic payments.

client_content.name: National Universities, Research and Strategic Planning Centers
PEC (Telecom Solutions)
client_content.description: A global telecommunications company that specializes in providing telecom Systems for TDM & VoIP phone companies, entrepreneurs, corporate offices, and many more.

client_content.name: Partners in Development Services (PDS)
client_content.description: A renowned regional think tank with registered and operational offices in Khartoum, Addis Ababa, Juba, Kigali and Kampala.

client_content.name: MobiPay
client_content.description: Africa-based company that offers a technology cloud-based model, an innovation designed to create farmer’s visibility and linkages of small-scale farmers to other value chain players.

client_content.name: AECOM
client_content.description: An American multinational infrastructure consulting firm that designs, builds, operates, and finances various infrastructure projects for businesses, governments, and organizations worldwide.

client_content.name: FingTech
client_content.description: FingTech is a Sudan-based next-generation global technology company that helps enterprises reimagine their businesses for the digital age.

client_content.name: Regional Research Centre for Integrated Development (RCID)
client_content.description: Regional Research Centre for Integrated Development (RCID) is a Rwanda based research, consultancy and project management firm.

client_content.name: LATTANZIO KIBS
client_content.description: Italian consulting boutique for the public sector operating on the global market.

client_content.name: ARPU TECH
client_content.description: ARPU Tech is a Telecom Value Added Servies (VAS) and IT solutions provider headquartered in Khartoum – Sudan.

project_content.title: Third-Party Monitoring of WFP Activities (COVID-19 Nutrition Support, TSFP, Blanket Supplementary Feeding Program) in Darfur Region (North, West, South, East) and Kordofan, as well as Agricultural Activities in Jasmar, Soba, Umkaddada, Alsiraf, Blue Nile States
Third-Party Monitoring of Food Basket (Commodity Distribution) in 11 IDP Returnee locations in Darfur States including Sharq Alneel, Umsalama, Khartoum & Karari
JICA’s Ex-Post Project Evaluation: Health Facility Electrification Project (H-HEP) with partners in River Nile, Gedaref, Kassala, Khartoum, South Kordofan, North Kordofan, Blue Nile States
Impact Assessment of Microleasing in Sudan (all of Sudan except the Darfur States) sponsored by SMDF
Microfinance Impact Assessment & 5-Year Business Plan for Sudanese Microfinance Development Company (SMDC)
Evaluation of Country Programs Funded by Qatar Fund for Development (QFFD) in Sudan
Assessment of Mother and Child Cash Transfer (MCCT) Programme in Kassala and Red Sea States for UNICEF
Tier 4 Microfinance Development Initiative Sponsored by Uganda Micro Finance Regulatory Authority (UMRA)
Technical support for core microfinance system (CMS) and ABC implementation for 5 Darfur State MFIs; sponsored by UNDP
Development of Business Plan and Operations Manuals for Greater Darfur Microfinance Apex Institution, sponsored by UNDP
Training in Value Chain Analysis & Designing Integrated Projects, and Small & Medium Enterprise (SME) Finance in Debra Zeit – Ethiopia
Value Chain Analysis of Hides and Skins Industry across the five states of Darfur
Third-Party Monitoring (TPM) of WFP Activities in 18 Sudan States
Capacity Change Scale & Ladder of Change Assessments of Strategic & Operational Partners in British Council’s Program – Kulana Lilaamu (KLP)
Mid-Term Evaluation of SMAP-1 Project in North, West and South Darfur States; sponsored by JICA
Assessment of Mother and Child Cash Transfer (MCCT) Programme in Kassala and Red Sea States for UNICEF
Training in Value Chain Analysis & Designing Integrated Projects, and Small & Medium Enterprise (SME) Finance in Debra Zeit – Ethiopia
Microfinance Impact Assessment in Sudan for the Sudanese Microfinance Development Company (SMDC)
JICA’s Ex-Post Project Evaluation: “Frontline Maternal and Child Health Empowerment Project (Mother Nile Project) Phase II in Sinnar, White Nile, Gezira, North Kordofan, Red Sea and Khartoum states
Baseline Survey for the Project for Strengthening Peace through the Improvement of Public Services in Darfur States (Water) – (known as SMAPII)
Management Information System (MIS) for the Agricultural Bank of Sudan MFI (ABSUMI), sponsored by IFAD
Financial Inclusion capacity building for mediators in Darfur (Civil societies, NGOs, unions and associations), sponsored by UNDP
Mid-Term Assessment of the Integrated Nutrition & Food Security Intervention (Stunting Project) in Eastern Sudan, sponsored by WFP
Evaluation of Qatar Fund For Development (QFFD) program on improvement of maternal and child health in Sudan through the implementation of the Sudan Public Health Training Initiative (SPHTI)
Performance Review of WFP’s Sudan Emergency Safety Net Project (SESNP) in 12 Sudan States
Feasibility Study for Development of Diplomatic Quarters (Block 3)- Real Estate Development Sponsored by UNDP
Value-Chain Analysis and Market Systems Assessment (various projects Sponsored by IFAD and UNDP)
Facilitation of Regional Economic Development Plans for various States in Sudan.
Socio-Economic Study of Business Opportunities and Support Services for DDR Participants in Khartoum (Sponsored by UNDP)
Development of the Red Sea State Regional Economic Development Plan, sponsored by Red Sea State & National Governments.
Impact Assessment of Microfinance in Sudan (all of Sudan except the Darfur States), sponsored by SMDF
Microfinance Impact Assessment & 5-Year Business Plan for Sudanese Microfinance Development Company (SMDC)
Baseline Survey of the Sustainable Natural Resources and Livelihoods Programme (SNRLP) Sponsored by IFAD
Technical support for core microfinance system (CMS) and implementation for Greater Darfur Microfinance Co. (GDMC) and the state-owned MFIs
Tier 4 Microfinance Development Initiative sponsored by Uganda Micro Finance Regulatory Authority (UMRA)
Provision of Management Information System (MIS) for the Agricultural Bank of Sudan MFIs (ABS/MU), sponsored by IFAD
Access to financial services strategy mediators training in Darfur States Sponsored by UNDP
Independent Final Evaluation of HealthPro Programme in Al Fasher and Nyala – North and South Darfur States, implemented by the Italian Agency for Development Cooperation (AICS) with funding from EU

Red Sea State Regional Economic Development Plan: Preparation of a comprehensive economic development plan for the Red Sea State and National Government through small/medium enterprise promotion, land use etc., plus cross cutting issues, such as, poverty eradication, HIV/AIDS, etc.
Mid-Term Assessment of Integrated Nutrition & Food Security (Uniting People) in Eastern Sudan; sponsored by WFP
Third-Party Monitoring (TPM) of UNICEF Activities in 14 Sudan States

Feasibility Study & Business Plan for Atnoor City, Khartoum, Sudan: Feasibility study and a preparation of business plan components and activities; cost estimates of construction, operations and maintenance; management and operations; financial projections and sensitivity analysis.
Mapping, Capacity Assessment & Capacity Development of Microfinance Providers in all Sudan States (UNDP Project)
Provision of a Mapping of Civil Society Organizations working on Women Peace and Security in Darfur Sponsored by UN Women.
Attractive, Peaceful and Conducive Environment for Livelihoods for Farmers, Pastoralists, IDP and Refugees Sponsored by South Kordofan State.
Training: Peace & Conflict management Committees (PCMC) Capacity Building Training and Youth Civic Education and Engagement sponsored by World Bank.
Baseline Survey for Project on Strengthening Peace through Public Services in Darfur States (Water) – (SMAPII), sponsored by JICA.
Reintegration Opportunities Mapping in Eastern Sudan (Red Sea, Kassala and Gedaref States) – Sponsored by IOM & UNDP.
Capacity building to strengthen the Role of Parliament in Democratic Governance in Sudan, sponsored by UNDP.
Development of business plans for 4 value-chains involving ex-combatants and vulnerable youth as principle links
Technical assistance and capacity development of Sudan State Ministry of Animal Resources and other gov. entities to utilize value chain interventions
Assessment of the Impact of Scaling Learning Through Play (LtP) in Rwanda’s In-service Teacher Training Program - UNICEF
Assessment of Student Learning in 9 Camps and their Host Community in Eastern Sudan, sponsored by UNHCR
Assessment of Business Opportunities & Training Needs for Strengthening Vocational Training in South Kordofan State, sponsored by JICA
Tier 4 Microfinance Development Initiative Sponsored by Uganda Microfinance Regulatory Authority (UMRA)
Youth & Women Training of Trainers on: Peace, Building, FoRB, Human Rights, Advocacy, Gender Mainstreaming, Sponsored by FECCLAHA
Training to Sudanese Bankers, Microfinance Executives and Consultants (World Bank and CBoS)
Multiple peace engagements and co-authoring Joint Assessment Mission (JAM) Report & Framework for reconstruction of Sudan.
Capacity Building & Peace Engagements (Sudan Peace Development Project – SPDP), sponsored by the World Bank
Youth & Women Training of Trainers on Peace Building, FoRB, Human Rights, Advocacy, Gender Mainstreaming, Sponsored by FECCLAHA.
Tier 4 Microfinance Development Initiative Sponsored by Uganda Micro Finance Regulatory Authority (UMRA)

Real-Estate Development Project for Khartoum State: Feasibility Study for Development of Diplomatic Quarters (Block 3)- Real Estate Development for Khartoum State. PACT Conducted market survey of existing and planned developments; surveyed potential buyers, conducted research, prepared and submitted feasibility study.
Support to the Sudanese Development Initiative Association (SUDIA) to develop into a sustainable Microfinance Institution (MFI) Sponsored by World Bank & Central Bank of Sudan
Training to Sudanese Bankers, Microfinance Executives and Consultants (World Bank and CBoS)
Financial Inclusion and MFI Projects in Sudan and Uganda
Development of Business Plan and Operation Manuals for Greater Darfur Microfinance Apex Institution, sponsored by UNDP
Feasibility Studies, Assessments, Business Plan Development and Capacity Building for various Microfinance Institutions in Sudan

hero_slides.title: PACT Consultancy (PACT)
hero_slides.description: is a leading global development consulting company with core footprints in Africa, Middle East and USA.

about_content.title: About PACT Consultancy
about_content.subtitle: Who We Are
about_content.description:
PACT Consultancy is a leading development consulting firm specializing in poverty reduction, MSME development, agriculture, peace building, and public health.

With over a decade of experience, we partner with governments, NGOs, and international organizations to design and implement sustainable development solutions across Africa and beyond.

footer_content.company_description: PACT Consultancy is a leading development consulting firm specializing in poverty reduction, MSME development, agriculture, peace building, and public health. With over a decade of experience, we partner with governments, NGOs, and international organizations to design and implement sustainable development solutions across Africa and beyond.
footer_content.address: Multiple Locations: Doha, Qatar; Khartoum, Sudan; Kampala, Uganda; Richmond VA, USA; Juba, South Sudan; Kigali, Rwanda; Canonniers Point, Mauritius
